intro: Meriolix serrulata, commonly known as the serrated meriolix, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have serrated edges, giving it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
